Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Indonesia 
    Pyongyang June 18 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" was brought out in booklet by Hekadaha Publishing and Printing Company of Indonesia on June 9.
 The work, published on April 18, Juche 87 (1998), clarifies the historic five-point policy of the great national unity which serves as important guidelines in achieving the Korean nation's great unity.    
 The company in the preface said that it has the honor to reprint his famous work on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and hopes the work will help the readers correctly understand the nature of the Korean reunification issue and the reunification policy of the DPRK.

articles.content:
Floral Baskets and Congratulatory Letters to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received floral baskets and congratulatory letters from the diplomatic corps and officials in charge of the cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 The floral basket and congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here were conveyed to Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun by Palestinian Ambassador E. P. Shaher Mohammed Abdlah who is doyen of the corps and the floral basket and congratulatory letter in the name of the officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations were conveyed to an official concerned by Mahmoud Masoud Amer, senior councilor of the People's Bureau of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya here, on June 17.

British Ambassador Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang June 18 (KCNA) -- David Arthur Slinn, British ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, hosted a reception Thursday evening on the occasion of the birthday of the Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, the official holiday.
 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yong Sul, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here.
 Speeches were made at the reception.
